title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Thursday, 5 May 2016 - BBC News
summary: a man who murdered a luton shopkeeper , and a man who attempted to murder his wife years later in the same shop , were both visitors to a homeless day centre .
an inquest into the death of man at luton police station last year continues this morning at ampthill coroner 's court .
a man is still being held by milton keynes police on sus of murdering a woman who 's gone missing .
plans have been announced for a landmark high-rise building in central milton keynes .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume on thursday at 08:00 .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from us today for local live in beds , herts and bucks - thanks for joining us .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 to bring you the latest news , including the election results , across the three counties .
enjoy the sunshine !

documents.title: homes damaged by fire and goats rescued
text: three homes were damaged , and goats and chickens rescued in luton last night after a fire in a garden spread .
firefighters were called to pembroke avenue just after 17:00 where they found the fire quickly spreading to terraced houses .
two goats were saved and chickens released by officers .
two outhouses were destroyed and three properties seriously damaged .

documents.title: luton pensioner finds pet cat decapitated
text: a luton pensioner found her beloved pet cat decapitated in her garden - sparking claims from an animal rights charity that the croydon cat killer has started operating in bedfordshire .
author: Bedfordshire on Sunday

documents.title: further investment into royston based hotel chocolat on the way
text: the royston businessman and founder of hotel chocolat is to invest further in the company after the firm was valued at £ 167m .
in an initial public offering on the london stock exchange , the valuation has netted company founder , angus thirlwell , more than £ 20m .
mr thirwell said he plans to invest further in its british chocolate manufacturing operations , new stores and digital offering .

documents.title: natalie hemming investigation : police have car in their possession
text: police investigating the disappearance of a mother-of-three from milton keynes , want people who saw a specific car to come forward .
officers have the black ford s-max sport in their possession , but would like to know where it `` was between 21:45 on sunday and the early hours of the bank holiday monday . ''
det supt chris ward said : `` we believe that vehicle travelled along the a413 from milton keynes into aylesbury , has travelled on the aylesbury side of the a41 and it 's also used the a418 . ''
a 42-year-old man has been arrested on sus of murdering natalie hemming , 31 , who has n't been seen since sunday .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: afternoon headlines : car appeal in missing case cctv examined in inquest
text: the latest headlines :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : fine and dry with lots of sunshine
text: tonight : staying fine and dry with long spells of sunshine and light easterly winds .
lows of 6c ( 43f ) .
pollen levels will stay high .
tomorrow : another fine and dry day with high temperatures .
high level cloud in the afternoon will turn the sunshine hazy later , but it will be a very pleasant afternoon .
highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: istiak yusuf 'may have survived ' with quicker treatment
text: a man who died in police custody in luton after taking a concoction of drugs `` may have survived '' if medical help had been summoned earlier , a consultant has told the inquest .

dr nigel langford , a consultant in emergency medicine , talked about seizures brought on by cocaine use , and examining cctv of istiak yusuf in his cell said he was in seizure , which could be seen by movement in his arm .
dr langford said if patients who 've ingested cocaine `` receive immediate medical treatment '' prospects can be good .
in this case , mr yusuf was taken to hospital while in cardiac arrest .
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: businessman threatened with arrest by bogus officer
text: a hertfordshire businessman who was the victim of a blackmail attempt was told he and his wife would be sent to prison and their children put into care .
st albans crown court heard the man was contacted by a bogus policeman to say he may be arrested for money laundering from heroin dealing .
the man feared the threats came from a genuine officer so contacted someone he knew to involve the police internal investigations department .
chris middleton , 27 , of stevenage has been jailed for two years for his part in the scam .

documents.title: blackmail scam man 'wanted to make easy money '
text: a man jailed for his part in blackmailing a hertfordshire businessman after he ran up gambling debts of £ 30,000 had wanted to make `` easy money '' .

the judge at st albans crown court jailed chris middleton , 27 , of stevenage , for two years but acknowledged he was a `` junior partner '' and the person who instigated the scam had not been brought to justice
`` his father is a retired police officer and his mother a retired teacher .
he is very ashamed at what he has done , '' claire dowse , defending , said .

documents.title: travel : a507 closed in clophill
text: the a507 is closed in clophill between the a6 and warren lane due to a vehicle fire .
police are directing traffic .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: custody death man had 'highest ever seen ' cocaine in body
text: the amount of cocaine in the body of luton man istiak tusuf was the `` one of the highest ever seen , '' according to a forensic specialist giving evidence at the third day of an inquest into his death in police custody .
the jury at ampthill coroners court heard kerry taylor , a senior forensic toxicologist , describe how any concentration of cocaine found in a blood sample above four would be classed as high .
she said mr yusuf 's blood had a level of 11.3 .
ms taylor said the level of ecstacy was not considered to be high .
neither was the level of alcohol in the blood , but the reaction of alcohol mixed with cocaine would have created the metabolite cocaethylene that killed him .
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: bedfordshire elephant has tooth removed
text: lucha , a 33-year-old asian elephant , had an infected tooth which was causing her discomfort , so keepers called in a specialist zoo dentist .
whipsnade zoo said lucha had been off her food .
they had a closer look and found the problem .
her whole tooth was removed and she 's now back on her feet
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mother swan found dead on her nest in milton keynes
text: a mother swan has been found dead on her nest in milton keynes following an animal attack .
author: One MK

documents.title: man jailed for blackmailing hertfordshire businessman
text: the son of a retired police officer has been jailed for two years for his part in the blackmail of a hertfordshire businessman .
chris middleton , 27 , of webb rise , stevenage , was looking for money to pay off gambling debts when he got involved in the scam .
st albans crown court heard he was offered £ 5,000 .
the victim was contacted by a bogus policeman who threatened arrest for money laundering from drug dealing .
middleton was caught when he delivered a package involved in the scam at a post office .

documents.title: road reopens after fire in standon
text: dowsetts lane in standon , hertfordshire has reopened after firefighters dealt with a refuse fire in a builders yard .
the fire service have finished at dowsett lane and the road is now opening shortly .

documents.title: nursery raise money for children 's a & e in watford
text: i just had to share this photograph of the nursery staff who took part in an extreme obstacle course to raise money for watford hospital .
this was their team photograph before the race .
i wonder if they realised at this point what they 'd let themselves in for ?
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hertfordshire nursery 's tough mudder challenge for watford hospital
text: a nursery based in hertfordshire has raised almost £ 4,000 for the children 's emergency department at watford hospital .

the boys & girls nursery team took part in tough mudder , a `` hardcore obstacle race '' , to raise money for an infusion pump for the department , which is used for children who can not take on fluids and risk dehydration .
about 40 members of staff took part and completed the course in five hours and 40 minutes .
i am so proud of the team who participated .
we had a great day . ''
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good news from forecaster dan holley for the weekend
text: it 's one of those days where we 're going to talk about the weather a fair bit on here
one , because it 's sunny .
two , because we 're british !
e anglia : most parts of the region will have a dry and warm weekend , small risk of an isol thunderstorm in the far w on sunday afternoon/eve
@ twitterid when are we going to get comfortable temps ?
me and heat have a love hate relationship !
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: natalie hemming : police search for car after murder arrest
text: police searching for a missing mother-of-three have released a of a car they say `` may be connected '' with her disappearance .
natalie hemming , 31 , of alderney avenue , newton leys , was reported missing on tuesday and police arrested a 42-year-old man from milton keynes on sus of murder yesterday .
the black ford s-max titan x sport is believed to have travelled on the a413 , a418 and a41 around aylesbury between 21:45 on sunday and 00:45 on bank holiday monday .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather watchers : sunshine in bedford
text: we 're not sure about you , but we wish we were outside today .
this scene in bedford looks very inviting .
we 're getting more and more photographs of sunny , blue skies dropping in from our weather watchers
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: garden sheds broken into in hertfordshire village
text: four garden sheds have been targeted by thieves in the hertfordshire village of northaw .
police say offenders entered the back gardens of four properties in the ridgway between 17:00 on 28 april and 10:00 on 29 april .
gardening equipment and tools were stolen , so officers are asking anyone who may have seen such items being loaded into a vehicle to come forward .

documents.title: hazlemere resident turns 100
text: a feisty '' hazlemere resident marked her 100th birthday with a family celebration last week .
author: Bucks Free Press

documents.title: lunchtime headlines : missing woman murder arrest custody death inquest continues
text: the headlines this lunchtime :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: fire at builders yard in hertfordshire
text: firefighters are at the scene of a fire in a builders yard in standon , hertfordshire .
they were called at 12:25 , where they found `` refuse well alight '' .
four pumps are in attendance .
we are currently assisting @ twitterid on dowsetts lane , standon with a fire .
at the moment the road is closed .
dowsetts lane is closed , you will not be allowed near the fire .
sorry if this causes any inconvenience .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cell death man had 'fit or seizure '
text: cell death man had 'fit or seizure '

documents.title: homeless centre defends link to crimes
text: the chief executive of a homeless day centre in luton has defended its role after it was linked to a murder and attempted murder in the town .
yesterday , tomasz jaworski , 30 , pleaded guilty to the attempted murder of nirupa patel , who was stabbed at moon 's newsagents in park street on christmas eve .
her husband was murdered at the shop in 2009 .
bbc three counties radio has learnt that both the attackers were visitors to noah enterprise .

`` i think you can never do enough , but within the constraints of the resources available , we have not only done enough , we 've gone the extra mile and many extra miles , '' said noah enterprise 's chief executive jim o'connor .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: guide to the may 2016 elections
text: people in the east of england are going to the polls today , in the uk 's biggest set of elections outside of a general election for some years .
take a look at this bbc guide to find out what you can vote for and how .

documents.title: hertfordshire boy to travel to invictus games
text: bushey 's rio woolf , seven , is travelling to the invictus games in florida this week to meet his heroes .
rio was born without a shinbone , knee or ankle , and had his lower right leg amputated at just 14 months old .
about three years ago he had a special carbon fibre blade fitted .
this morning , he appeared on itv 's good morning britain to tell them all about it .
surely we win with rio , @ twitterid # boom !
@ bladeboyrio @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid

he will go far with that attitude .
lovely !

documents.title: body found in stevenage lake
text: police are investigating the discovery of a body in the lake at fairlands valley park in stevenage .
the man was found near the boat house at 09:30 .
they 're not treating his death as sus

documents.title: weather : dry , warm and sunny
text: this afternoon will be dry , warm and sunny with light winds .
there will be some very high cloud overhead which will make the sunshine look a bit hazy at times .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: gang tied up three people in borehamwood robbery
text: a group of seven men forced their way into a borehamwood flat and tied the occupants up before stealing phones and jewellery .
the robbers entered the flat in shenley road on 28 april between 00:00 and 01:45 wearing dark clothing with hoods and balaclavas .
the victims , two men and one woman , were assaulted during the incident , sustaining bruising , and one man suffered a cut to his head .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stevenage under-11 goes to arsenal
text: stevenage have agreed a fee with arsenal for under-11 goalkeeper jamie telfer .
stevenage say there will be considerable further payments if the youngster ever plays for the arsenal first team .
telfer has been with the stevenage academy for the past 18 months , attracting the attention of a number of clubs .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: custody drugs death man istiak yusuf 'fit and well '
text: today marks the third day of an inquest into the death of luton man istiak yusuf in police custody last june .
ampthill coroner 's court has this morning heard from dr ashley fegan-earl , a forensic pathologist who carried out the post mortem .
he said mr yusuf was a `` fit and well , well-nourished young man with no signs of disease '' .
he said samples taken from mr yusuf `` showed a high level of cocaine '' as well as mdma and alcohol .
he added levels of such drugs .
`` would explain this gentleman 's sudden death '' , and it was likely he suffered a seizure .
mr fegan-earl said he could not tell when or how mr yusuf took the drugs .
author: Kate Bradbrook
BBC Look East

documents.title: mk dons training facility at cosgrove is 'good news , ' says chairman pete winkelman
text: i 've been speaking to the chairman of mk dons pete winkelman , following the clubs relegation to league one .
he told me a proposed training facility is `` good news '' for the area of south northamptonshire at cosgrove where it would be built
author: James Burridge
BBC Look East

documents.title: milton keynes high-rise plan will remove 'hundreds of parking spaces '
text: plans have been announced for a landmark high-rise building in central milton keynes which would be double the height of the tallest existing building .
it would feature a restaurant , apartments and offices .

john silver , director at doone silver architects , said it would be a `` distinctive addition to the skyline '' which will `` signal a new era of development for the city '' , but theo chalmers from urban eden , which promotes the original milton keynes master plan , said the proposals would mean the removal of `` hundreds of parking spaces '' .
mr chalmers said there are already empty office buildings on the north side of midsummer boulevard that are n't used due to a lack of spaces .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather watchers : sunny day with blue skies
text: it 's looking like a sunny day out there with some wonderful blue skies , according to our weather watchers inbox .
this is what leavesden country park in abbots langley is looking like this morning .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: travel : a413 in bucks and m1 in beds slow
text: one lane is blocked on the a413 in both directions at new road in aylesbury .
traffic is slow and affecting the high street .
on the m1 northbound , there is one lane closed due to an obstruction in the road between j11-j12 .
traffic is very slow .
stay up-to-date here .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: james mccartney refuses to talk about his dad in bbc interview
text: sir paul mccartney 's son refused to talk about his legendary dad live on the radio while promoting his latest album , telling the bbc three counties presenter : `` i 'm not asking you about your father . ''
author: The Sun

documents.title: watch : milton keynes high rise plans announced
text: there 's a rumbling today about the high rise plans announced for milton keynes .
here 's a little visualisation of what they might look like
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tower block plan for central milton keynes
text: plans have been announced for two high-rise buildings in central milton keynes .
the new city was originally planned to have no building taller than the biggest tree .
one of the tower blocks on the proposed development on a 1.5 acre site on midsummer boulevard could be more than 20 storeys high and is due to consist of offices , flats and a skyline restaurant .

julie clay from milton keynes development partnership said the final height would depend on how much is office and how much is residential , but developer sterling anticipate it will be twice the height of the current tallest building in the town - the 12-storey hub building .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest headlines : homeless centre defends link to crimes missing woman murder arrest
text: the top stories this morning :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: mk dons manager looks set to stay despite relegation
text: milton keynes dons manager karl robinson looks set to stay at stadium : mk after backing from chairman pete winkelman .
both men have been critical of various aspects of the club 's relegation from the championship , but winkelman says they are now looking forward .
he said robinson has shown the club `` tremendous loyalty '' during times of success , adding `` equally when we got things wrong we got things wrong together , i need to show that loyalty back '' .
author: James Burridge
BBC Look East

documents.title: murdered shopkeeper 's daughter supports centre where attacker was visitor
text: the daughter of a murdered luton shopkeeper whose mother was also attacked in the same place years later , has said she 's not in favour of closing a homeless day centre where both attackers were visitors - but said they need more support .

the man who murdered jashbai patel in moon 's newsagents in park street in 2009 and the man who attempted to murder his wife nirupa last christmas eve , were both visitors to the noah enterprise , less than half a mile away .

mrs patel 's daughter , jaina , said noah does `` above and beyond what they should be doing , '' but added that it needs more support and more funding `` so they can do more for that community and employ more people '' .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: luton town fan stays behind by himself to see cobblers crowned champions
text: images of a luton town fan who stayed behind on his own to applaud opponents northampton being crowned champions have gone viral after being heralded the ultimate sporting gesture '' .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: man held on sus of murder in missing woman case
text: a man is still being held by milton keynes police on sus of murdering a woman who 's gone missing .
natalie hemming , 31 , from alderney avenue in newton leys was last seen on sunday afternoon in hemel hempstead .
police were alerted to her disappearance by a relative on tuesday .
on wednesday afternoon , a 42-year-old man from milton keynes was arrested on sus of murder .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: homeless day care centre link to luton attackers
text: a man who murdered a luton shopkeeper , and a man who attempted to murder the shopkeeper 's wife years later in the same store , were both visitors to a nearby homeless day centre , bbc three counties radio has learned .
on wednesday , tomasz jaworski , 30 , who visited the noah shelter , pleaded guilty to the attempted murder of nirupa patel , who was stabbed at moon 's newsagents in park street on christmas eve .
mrs patel 's husband jashbai was also murdered in the same shop by paranoid schizophrenic richard dettmer in june 2009 .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: polls open in council and pcc elections
text: voting has begun in council elections in hertfordshire and milton keynes .
elections are also taking place to choose police and crime commissioners in bedfordshire , hertfordshire and the thames valley .
a third of seats in milton keynes , and in the hertfordshire councils of broxbourne , north herts , st albans , stevenage and three rivers , are being contested .
boundary changes mean full council elections in watford and welwyn hatfield .
polling stations opened at 07:00 and will close at 22:00 .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: latest headlines : shopkeeper murderer and separate attacker both visited homeless centre man held on sus of murdering missing woman
text: here are the top stories we 're looking at this morning :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: today 's weather : warm and sunny
text: after a chilly start , the sunshine is set to continue with another dry , warm and mostly sunny day .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f ) .
get the detailed forecast where you live at bbc weather .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome to local live for beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live page for the three counties .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel from now until 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can tweet us or send an email .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live
